com.bham.bd.components.characters

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bham.bd.entity.BaseGameEntity
      • com.bham.bd.entity.MovingEntity
        • com.bham.bd.components.characters.GameCharacter
          • com.bham.bd.components.characters.Player

  • public class Player
extends GameCharacter
    Represents a character controlled by the user

      • ring

        public void ring()
        Causes an explosion effect - adds a ring explosion trigger to the game

      • updateAngle

        private void updateAngle()
        Updates angle at which the player is facing

        This method goes through every direction in the directionSet, coverts them to basis vectors, adds them up to get a final direction vector and normalizes it to set the heading param.

      • fire

        private void fire()
        Shoots a default bullet (or multiple)

        This method creates new instance(-s) of DefaultBullet based on player's position and angle.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
        Handles pressed key

        If one of the control keys are pressed, namely, W, A, S or D, a corresponding Direction is added to the directionSet. If the key F is pressed, then an appropriate bullet is fired

        Parameters:
        e - key to handle

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
        Handles released key

        If one of the control keys are released, namely, W, A, S or D, a corresponding Direction is removed from the directionSet

        Parameters:
        e - key to handle

      • getNumDirKeysPressed

        public int getNumDirKeysPressed()
        Gets the number of direction keys currently pressed (i.e., from a set of WASD)
        Returns:
        size of the direction set

        Hit-box is a shape with size and location properties. In most cases it is either a circle or a rectangle.
